author: Special Correspondent
text:
With the Election Commission launching #TN100percent campaign aimed at achieving maximum voting percentage during the May 16 Assembly polls in the State, the district authorities have stepped up their efforts to reach out to voters.

The district administration has launched a signature campaign among college students and a special drive to reach out to voters by sending in pamphlets to households through schoolchildren as part of the Systematic Voters Education and Electoral Participation (SVEEP) programme.

In at another initiative targeted at the youth, the district authorities joined hands with the students of the National Institute of Technology, Tiruchi, to organise a novel campaign on Wednesday to spread the message.

Human formation

Over 650 students of the institute came together to make a human formation depicting ‘#TN100percent,’ to raise awareness among voters.

District Collector K.S. Palanisamy inaugurated the initiative in the presence of S. Sundarrajan, Director, NIT-T and other officials of the institute.

Mr. Palanisamy urged the students to take the message on the importance of exercising the franchise among their family, friends, relatives, and neighbours.

Similarly, all those who have attained the age of 18 should enrol themselves in the voters list.

All efforts were made to ensure free and fair conduct of the polls, he said and the SVEEP campaign had been launched across the district urging voters to exercise their franchise as per their conscience.

A short film on voter awareness was screened on the occasion by the Department of Information and Public Relations.
title: Poll panel campaign reaches NIT-T
